Title: Software Engineer II, Storefront
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfilment Optimisation team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimising for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfilment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 
What You Will Do:

Flex your strength and knowledge on Java, DevOps, and microservices development.
Define and ensure services are built to industry best practices, including observability, architectural patterns, and inter-team dependency mechanisms (like SLOs)
Work closely with architects and other teams across Storefront to breakdown an existing PHP monolith into well defined Java Microservices with clean boundaries and clear API contracts
Serve as the local technical lead in the critical domain, designing & building a platform that interfaces with many different systems within and outside Wayfair and partner globally.
Architect and write code to implement high-quality, scalable, future-proof services that will have effective system boundaries and will support long-term vision & strategy
Conduct technical debate across an entire platform and help come to durable documented conclusions
Drive high-impact architectural solutions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation, and proactive troubleshooting
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet the department's technical vision
Work closely with product managers, designers, and peer engineering teams to define project requirements and execution plans
 
We Are a Match Because You Have:
3+ years of experience in engineering, with a preference for candidates with a mix of start-up and large-company experience
eComm domain expertise is a bonus
Hands-on experience driving software transformations within high-growth environments at scale
Experienced in architecting and building large-scale, cloud-based, and event-driven systems across various projects
Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience driving teams forward and ability to influence results
GCP target cloud platform, experience with AWS/Azure at scale
Distributed microservices architectures with well architected domain boundaries
High volume async messaging architectures
Large scale relational and NoSQL style data stores
Common open source platforms, tools and framework, eg: Kafka, Kubernetes, Containerization, Java microservices, GraphQL APIs, Aerospike etc.

Title: Senior Supply Chain Analyst
RoleDescription:
Office Based: London EC1V 7LQ
Hours: 40 hour per week, Monday to Friday
Benefits: Wayfair Employee Discount, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership,  Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days starting Holiday (with tenure entitlement) + Bank Holidays,  Pension, Cycle to Work scheme amongst others.
Driving global cross functional initiatives to improve Dropship speed 
Speed is top of mind for both our customers and our suppliers and is an important driver of sales conversion. Wayfairs Global Order to Ship team is responsible for improving customer experience by driving global, cross-functional initiatives to accelerate network performance across Castlegate and dropship fulfillment.
Operating out of our London office, as a Senior Analyst you will work closely with multiple cross-functional stakeholders to identify & drive actual speed improvements in the UK network; with a particular focus on leading initiatives to improve supplier dropship speed performance through close collaboration with Category Management.
If you have a talent for quickly building trusting partnerships, identifying the challenges between suppliers and carriers, whilst acting as a conduit to remove the barriers - We cant wait to get you started on our exciting journey.
Primary Responsibilities

Manage speed projects to improve actual order-to-ship / order-to-delivery speed globally. 
Actively integrate data, leveraging analytics to scope and implement levers to drive speed & reliability globally, and create monitoring tools to track progress.
Build and nurture close partnerships with our Category Management team to ensure successful implementation of driven initiatives.
Collaborate with other global cross-functional partners to drive team goals including Operations, Services, GSCI & Transportation.
Coordinate peak planning initiatives for high volume events.
Monitor and troubleshoot key performance indicators of speed and take corrective actions.
Offer SME Speed Support for Category Management via slack, Infohub or required training.
Communicate performance trends and improvement opportunities to leadership.

Requirements

Proven success operating within an analytical focused role providing agile business insights for impactful business decisions. Ideally, within an operational/ supply chain environment.
Hold a Bachelors degree in an Analytical, Supply Chain, Economics or Engineering quantitative field; or be qualified by experience.
Advanced experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI).
Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration.
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously.
Excellent communication skills (written, verbally & in person), someone who can translate complex data in a clear and concise manner to quickly build strong and trusting stakeholder partnerships.
The aptitude to effectively navigate IT systems and multiple applications simultaneously.

RoleDescription:

Who We Are







 




To win in the home goods space, Wayfair has to make strategic decisions with extensive and asymmetric awareness of the competitive landscape. CompIntel acquires the data for competitive insights and decisioning, namely exact competitor matches which power target price for branded products (matching to lowest tier 1 competitor price) and market / competitor price indices, and competitive share tracking via 3rd party credit card and POS data.
We are looking for a Manager to help drive the acquisition and maintenance of product matches, and procure competitive insights to help inform strategic decisions. In this role, you will tightly partner with our Technology team in advancing our match acquisition and maintenance processes with a focus on automation while maintaining accuracy through tight audit processes. To prioritize the right new matches and identify new opportunities in our workflows, you will also tightly partner with leaders across our commercial team, including Pricing and Category Management. As part of the competitive insights workstream, you will closely work with Business Trends and Category leadership to prioritize investigations and share insights. This is a highly visible workstream with exposure up to C-suite.  
 
What You'll Do

Coach & lead a team of 1-2 direct reports and indirect oversight of Analysts who own specific subsets of the CompIntel Strategy & Ops agenda (Branded Matches, Differentiated Matches, Merchandising Analytics, Cross-store Ops, 3rd party credit card data, POS data, ship speed)  
Maintain our share tracking indices, including the Yipit home pureplay index and the Yipit broad catalog competitors cuts (tracking our share by category / class vs. Amazon, Walmart, Target, Home Depot, Lowes and Costco), and manage our global POS relationships (Circana and GFK)
Help broaden our competitive insights, leveraging 3rd party credit card, POS data, and internal product match / order data. Ensure the plan is aligned with Business Trends and Commercial leadership
Drive alignment in recurring meetings, including Monthly and Weekly Business Reviews (MBRs and WBRs)
Manage OKRs for the CompIntel Strategy & Ops team, and tightly partner with Tech Leadership on aligning on corresponding OKRs in their respective spaces 
Oversee of the Offshore Labor budget 
Drive the prioritization of new CompIntel match acquisition together with Pricing and Category leadership, and identify the most effective approach to acquire these matches 
Regularly retest our current processes and flows, including crawling schedules, match accuracy, cost/match and match rate (the success of finding a match / attempt which is of particular importance for manual matches) 
Work with Technology to identify and prioritize bug fixes (e.g. crawling issues)

What You'll Need

3+ years of work experience in analytical, consulting, investment banking, technology, startup, or strategy roles
Bachelors degree from top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business or related field is a plus
Proven track record in driving results along a set of key output metrics and OKRs 
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypothesis and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings and thread a narrative, and share / align messaging with stakeholders
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact, and how CompIntel fits in
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high stakes team environment
Advanced Excel / Google Sheets skills; Experience with SQL or Google Big Query is a plus but not required

Title: Head of Product - Data & AI
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position must be based in Toronto, Canada or Boston, Massachusetts and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements (T/W/TH in office).
Head of Product, Data & AI
Who You Are: 
 
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. These experiences are driven by a cutting-edge set of data and machine learning, analytics, and operational systems that work in an integrated fashion to deliver a world class shopping experience for our customers. Business applications of these systems span many fields including recommendations, marketing, supply chain optimization and merchandising. These fields require a sophisticated technology stack that allows for configurability for rapid testing and exploration. 
 
We are looking for a seasoned Product leader to join our Platforms Product team to lead a team of Product Managers working on multiple facets of our Data and AI Platforms, including real-time, batch, analytics, and also Generative AI capabilities. These platforms are leveraged by nearly all our employees for operational and analytical purposes, or for powering our AI applications geared towards internal processes and our customer and supplier experiences.
 
Were looking for someone who not only enjoys creating a bold vision, but also executing on their ideas through fruition on a global scale. In this role, you will own a range of products that will offer cloud native Data & AI capabilities to our Engineers, Analysts, and Data Scientists developing customer and supplier-focused platforms. Your goal will be to empower any team across the company with self-service software (with data or AI needs) to deploy, manage, and integrate their applications utilizing our data platforms.
 
This person will act with a high degree of freedom and ownership, setting platform vision, forming strong relationships with senior cross-functional partners (both technical and non-technical), aligning on a shared vision for success, and delivering results that create meaningful business impact. This Product leader will serve as the subject matter expert, drive adoption for new use cases, and continually improve our platform capabilities. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in product management, a deep understanding of data technologies, and a proven track record of leading and developing high-performing teams.
 
What Youll Do:

Product Leadership: Develop and drive the overall strategy for our Data & AI Platforms, ensuring alignment with platforms strategy, along with delivering value for your users with in market usable solutions

Team Management: Lead, mentor, and manage a team of Product Managers, creating an integrated strategy across your products, fostering a culture of collaboration, measurement and creating space to learn and improve.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Data Science, Analytics, and other key stakeholders to ensure our data platforms meet their needs and drive business value.
Market Analysis: Stay abreast of industry trends and competitive landscape to inform product decisions and identify opportunities for innovation and improvement.
Product Metrics: Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data platform products and drive continuous improvement.
Driving adoption and value realization: Market your product internally to various departments to ensure all available users know about your product and how they could value from it
Communication: Articulate product vision, strategy, and roadmap to internal and external stakeholders, ensuring transparency and alignment across the organization. Maintain a product vision and roadmap, keeping stakeholders and constituents up to date on the top level goals and timelines

7+ years of experience in product management, with at least 3 years in a leadership role overseeing data platforms or similar technologies.
5+ years of product experience in developing data-driven products that are cloud native 
Strong understanding of data movement technologies (batch and real-time), Data Lakes, analytical data systems, GenAI tools and applying models to real-world problems.
Strong written and verbal communication and a demonstrated ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Proven experience in leading and collaborating with senior stakeholders along with a multi-quarter roadmap with iterative value delivery

Reporting to the Department Manager, you will oversee critical store functions for teams, and assist across team verticals including operational excellence, visual merchandising and design, and team development, to ensure an exceptional customer experience, drive a high performance team, and deliver on overall business targets.

The ideal candidate thrives in leading large teams, in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. They should be excited to excel while balancing priorities, and have a proven track record of coaching, mentoring, and developing talent to achieve results. Join Wayfair to help lead, innovate, and shape the in-store experience as we redefine the definition of retail excellence.
 
What Does an Assistant Store Manager (ASM) Do?

Adapt Under Pressure: Excel in managing competing priorities, navigating high-pressure situations with poise and efficiency, and ensuring seamless store operations and team productivity.
Demonstrate Operational Versatility: Demonstrate expertise in overseeing store functions, including sales performance, asset protection, safety compliance, and customer engagement, from opening through closing of daily store operations. Serve as a keyholder to help open or close the store as needed.
Execute Sales-Driven Leadership: Leverage a deep understanding of proactive sales environments and proven tactics to strategically inspire, motivate, and lead teams to exceed performance goals and deliver exceptional results.
Coach and Develop Teams: Youll embody strong leadership and professional maturity while providing actionable feedback and guidance across all teams to drive strong business results and foster associate growth. This will also include accountability conversations and coaching in-the-moment to ensure all team members meet expectations and demonstrate the Wayfair People Principles at all times.
Lead a First-in-Class Experience: Represent a deep understanding of Wayfairs customer-first commitment through product knowledge to assist customers, collaborate with all teams, and deliver an authentic, friendly, and memorable shopping experience.

Analytical Thinking: Ability to interpret sales trends, evaluate data, and implement strategies to drive business growth and strategically problem solve.


Embrace Innovation: Bring energy and creativity to the role by sharing ideas to improve operations within our operating guardrails to help enhance brand recognition, product presentation, and adapt to a fast-paced environment with evolving selection, promotions, and competing priorities.


What are the Specific Responsibilities of a Logistics ASM?

Inventory Accuracy: Maintain accurate tracking and organization of inventory across the sales floor and back of house, ensuring optimal stock levels and operational efficiency. You will also coordinate your teams to oversee furniture assembly.
Price and Audit Management: Verify product pricing accuracy and conduct regular audits to identify and address discrepancies, ensuring compliance and consistency.
Inbound and Receiving Operations: Oversee incoming shipments, including product quality and quantity verification, accurate inventory counts, and timely stock integration.
Returns and Exception Management: Manage the returns process, addressing inventory discrepancies and ensuring proper documentation, restocking, or disposal of items as needed.

Title: Architect, Supply Chain Retail Technology
RoleDescription:
Job Description
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.We are looking for a passionate Backend Architect to join the Supply Chain Retail Technology team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 
What Youll Do:

Be a technical leader within and across the teams you work with.
Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices.
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting.
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals.
Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization.
Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.

 
We Are a Match Because You Have:

12+ years of experience in backend software engineering architecting and implementing robust, distributed web applications
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
Track-record of technical leadership for teams following software development best practices (e.g. SOLID, TDD, GRASP, YAGNI, etc).
Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.
Experience building web services with Java , Spring Boot and Micro services . 
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience architecting solutions leveraging distributed infrastructure (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc).
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Aerospike, Redis.
Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, etc).
